Package com.mercadolibre.w4g9projetofinal.config

Class ExecutorConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mercadolibre.w4g9projetofinal.config.ExecutorConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.scheduling.annotation.AsyncConfigurer, org.springframework.scheduling.annotation.SchedulingConfigurer
    @EnableAsync
@EnableScheduling
@Configuration
public class ExecutorConfig
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.springframework.scheduling.annotation.AsyncConfigurer, org.springframework.scheduling.annotation.SchedulingConfigurer
    Represents async instructions configuration. See @EnableAsync for usage examples.
    See Also:
    EnableAsync

    • Method Detail

      • getAsyncExecutor

        @Bean(name="asyncExecutor",
      destroyMethod="shutdown")
public java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService getAsyncExecutor()
        Initializes async instruction execution using MeliExecutors. This enables the following features:
        • Telemetry in New Relic for async instructions.
        • Propagation of traceability.
        • Logger context propagation through MDC.
        Specified by:
        getAsyncExecutor in interface org.springframework.scheduling.annotation.AsyncConfigurer
        Returns:
        MeliExecutor for async instructions.

      • getAsyncUncaughtExceptionHandler

        public org.springframework.aop.interceptor.AsyncUncaughtExceptionHandler getAsyncUncaughtExceptionHandler()
        Creates a SimpleAsyncUncaughtExceptionHandler to be used when an exception is thrown during an asynchronous method execution with void return type.
        Specified by:
        getAsyncUncaughtExceptionHandler in interface org.springframework.scheduling.annotation.AsyncConfigurer
        Returns:
        SimpleAsyncUncaughtExceptionHandler.

      • configureTasks

        public void configureTasks​(org.springframework.scheduling.config.ScheduledTaskRegistrar taskRegistrar)
        Callback allowing a TaskScheduler and specific Task instances to be registered against the given the ScheduledTaskRegistrar.
        Specified by:
        configureTasks in interface org.springframework.scheduling.annotation.SchedulingConfigurer
        Parameters:
        taskRegistrar - the registrar to be configured.
